discussion.content:
Correct, 
to provide alert for inappropriate text, you can go to Purview Admin Center > Communication Compliance > Policies > Create Policy > Detect inappropriate text.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Teams.

You have two teams named Department1 and Department2.

You need to implement a security and compliance solution that meets the following requirements:

• Prevents the members of Department1 and Department2 from communicating with each other in Teams.
• Provides an alert if offensive language is used during a Teams chat.

Which Microsoft Purview feature should you use for each requirement? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

questions.question_text:
Your company uses Teams.

Users often use Teams mobile apps to make and receive calls.

You change the display name for a user named User1.

User1 reports that their previous name still appears when they receive incoming calls in the Teams mobile app.

You need to ensure that the updated display name for User1 appears.

What should you do?

HOTSPOT
-

Your company has offices in New York and Seattle.

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Teams.

You plan to assess network connectivity and make recommendations to optimize connectivity from each office to Teams.

You run the Microsoft 365 network connectivity test tool at both offices and produce the results shown in the following table.

//IMG//


For each of the following statements, select Yes if True. Otherwise select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

comments.content:
2.
*In summary, while deploying a VPN can introduce some additional latency due to encryption overhead, it can potentially improve latency by optimizing routing paths.

It could be positive or negative but from the most case, VPN affect your internet connection to be slower. Correct me if I'm wrong

discussion.content:
1. YES: 
-If you're working remotely and need to access resources on your organization's network while also using the internet for other tasks, split tunneling can be beneficial.
-In situations where you have limited bandwidth available, split tunneling can help optimize network performance.
2. NO:
-If your original internet connection is already slow, deploying a VPN might not improve latency significantly. The VPN can only work with the speed provided by your internet service.
3. YES:
-Implementing local internet breakout can potentially improve latency in certain scenarios. Local internet breakout refers to the practice of allowing local network traffic to access the internet directly without routing it through a central location or data center.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Teams. The subscription contains the users shown in the following table.

//IMG//


User3 owns a public team named Sales that contains two channels named Planning and Budgets.

You have the following custom blocked words list.


Project, Contoso, Group, Team
-

For each of the following statements, select Yes if True. Otherwise select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
I believe the answer is No, Yes, Yes.
No - due to the blocked word list.
Yes - due to the users role exemption.
Yes - due to key word "channel", not a Team. Can't find any documentation that specifies the custom blocked word list applies to channels. Only states it is for Group and Team names.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/solutions/groups-naming-policy?view=o365-worldwide

comments.content: *this* is the correct answer! Also tested in sandbox. The "user admin" is a role that is exempt from naming policy.

i agree, No - due to the blocked word list.
Yes - due to the users administrator is except 
Yes - due to key word "channel", not a Team.
See Admin Override: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/solutions/groups-naming-policy?view=o365-worldwide

discussion.content:
NO, NO, YES
Blocked word list only affect someone when they're creating a Team... Channel is not affected. Those admin also has no exception for this policy.

comments.content:
The following are the list of administrator roles exempted from the group naming policy.
• Global admin
• Partner Tier 1 Support
• Partner Tier 2 Support
• User account admin

discussion.content:
In summary:

 User 1 cannot create “Project A.”
 User 2 cannot create “Contoso.”
 User 3 cannot create a channel named “Contoso” within the “Sales” team.

Corect no,Yes,Yes
Some administrators are exempted from these policies, across all group workloads and endpoints, so that they can create groups with these blocked words and with their desired naming conventions. The following are the list of administrator roles exempted from the group naming policy.
• Global admin
• Partner Tier 1 Support
• Partner Tier 2 Support
• User account admin

comments.content: how is user 3 exempted when he does not have an privileges ?
User3 is creating channel and not a Team.. thats the difference.

choices.D: Create a data loss prevention (DLP) policy for Teams chat and channel messages.
choices.C: Create a retention policy for Teams chats.
choices.A: Create a retention policy for the SharePoint sites location.
choices.E: Create a retention policy for the OneDrive accounts location.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
We need a retention policy for files shared during Teams chats, not for files shared in Teams channels.

Files, shared in Teams chats, are stored in the senders onedrive.
Files shared in Teams channels , are stored in the sharepoint site of the team.

So, the answer is e, because of the keyword teams chats

Selected Answer: A
"All files shrared by using Microsoft Teams". Well, files shared in a chat are stored in one drive, and files shred in a Team are stored in SharePoint. I guess A is the better answer.

Selected Answer: A
The marketing department has two technical requirements:
Data retention and watermarks. The only answer that applies to either of these requirements is A. 
Teams is an overlay for Sharepoint files, therefore the Sharepoint file retention policy applies here. 
There is not an answer that applies to the watermark technical requirement.
More on watermarks - https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/watermark-meeting-content-video#:~:text=Configure%20watermarks,-For%20watermarks%20to&text=In%20the%20Teams%20admin%20center%2C%20expand%20Meetings%20and%20select%20Meeting,content%20to%20On%20or%20Off.

Selected Answer: A
Files shared in Team chats are stored in Sharepoint, therefore that needs to have a retention policy set to that duration.

questions.question_text:
Case study -


Overview -


Company Information -

ADatum Corporation is an energy company that has offices across North America and 3,000 employees.


Physical Locations -

ADatum has the offices shown in the following table.

//IMG//



Existing Environment -


Network Infrastructure -

The office in Calgary has a 1-Gbps internet circuit. The offices in San Diego and New York have 100-Mbps internet circuits. The field site in Edmonton has a 3-Mbps internet circuit.


Departments -

ADatum has the following departments:

• Information technology (IT)
• Project management
• Marketing

Microsoft 365 and Tenants Environment

ADatum recently purchased a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that has the Microsoft Teams Domestic Calling Plan add-on. All users are assigned Microsoft 365 E5 and Microsoft Teams Domestic Calling Plan licenses and Calling Plans is deployed.

Azure AD has the default Cross-tenant access settings configured.

The Teams policies settings are configured as shown in the following exhibit.

//IMG//


The Teams client is deployed to a non-persistent Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) used by the project management department.

Allow guest access in Teams is set to Off.

The Microsoft Viva Connections app is deployed to all users.


Problem Statements -

ADatum identifies the following issues:

• An executive at the San Diego office reports that video drops during Teams meetings.
• The Edmonton field site has limited bandwidth, and users report poor audio during Teams calls and meetings.
• Users in the project management department report that they cannot give or take control during Teams calls and meetings while sharing their VDI desktop.


Planned Changes -

ADatum plans to implement the following changes:

• Configure the media bit rate settings for the users at the Edmonton field site. The settings must apply only to the user while they are at the site, but NOT when they are at a different office.
• Create a Teams channel to enable the project management department to collaborate with the IT department on a device upgrade project.
• Implement a pilot rollout of Operator Connect for the users in the New York office. A port re-quest was accepted already.
• Create a Teams channel for the marketing department for external collaboration.
• Rename the Viva Connections icon as Start portal.


Technical Requirements -

ADatum identifies the following technical requirements:

• The marketing department requires that all the files shared by using Teams remain available for at least three years after deletion.
• The marketing department must be able to apply a watermark to content and video shared dur-ing Teams meetings.
• All users require indefinite access to training videos recorded in Teams by the IT department.
• All access to Teams and shared resources must use the principle of least privilege.
• Guest access must remain disabled.


You need to ensure that file sharing during Teams chats meets the technical requirements of the marketing department.

What should you do?
